radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple foci of uptake in the ribs on both sides, particularly on the left anterolaterally.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: CT scans performed 35 days after the FDG-PET showed healing fractures with callus formation in several ribs.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Opaque area in the left upper lobe.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: CT scan confirmed the abnormality in the left upper lobe. FDG-PET showed low-grade diffuse uptake consistent with inflammation and uptake in several ribs bilaterally.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Bone marrow replacement at the S1-S2 level, possibly due to fracture, discitis, or metastatic replacement.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: FDG-PET scan performed 8 weeks after the fall was normal. Follow-up over 3 years revealed no evidence of cancer.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Metabolically active solitary pulmonary nodule with low-grade activity in two foci in the lower left lateral chest wall, corresponding to rib fractures.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient had a right middle lobectomy 2 weeks after successful coronary artery bypass graft; the pulmonary nodule was confirmed as non-small-cell lung carcinoma without evidence of spread to lymph nodes.
